intro: Blepharocalyx giganteus var. montanus, commonly known as the giant mountain huito, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, lantern-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is known for its large, velvety leaves and can grow up to several meters in height. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its unique morphology and ecological significance make it a notable species in botanical studies.
